body:
I cannot produce this on master and it seems like the travis docs are generating the figure okay https://pandas-docs.github.io/pandas-docs-travis/visualization.html#scatter-matrix-plot. Are you generating this locally?

```
In [6]: pd.__version__
Out[6]: '0.24.0.dev0+1069.gdf5eeece8'

In [7]: df = pd.DataFrame(np.random.randn(1000, 4), columns=['a', 'b', 'c', 'd'])

In [8]: scatter_matrix(df, alpha=0.2, figsize=(6, 6), diagonal='kde')
Out[8]:
array([[<matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot object at 0x1a1780b518>,
        <matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot object at 0x1a178317b8>,
        <matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot object at 0x1a17859ac8>,
        <matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot object at 0x1a17884dd8>],
       [<matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot object at 0x1a178b6128>,
        <matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot object at 0x1a178b6160>,
        <matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot object at 0x1a17908668>,
        <matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot object at 0x1a17932978>],
       [<matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot object at 0x1a1795cc88>,
        <matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot object at 0x1a17987f98>,
        <matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot object at 0x1a179ba2e8>,
        <matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot object at 0x1a179e15f8>],
       [<matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot object at 0x1a17a0a908>,
        <matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot object at 0x1a17a34c18>,
        <matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot object at 0x1a17a5ff28>,
        <matplotlib.axes._subplots.AxesSubplot object at 0x1a17a92278>]],
      dtype=object)
```

Yes. I'm looking into it further and I think it's something with my matplotlib installation, so not a pandas issue.

Edit: for anyone who sees this in the future, installing pyqt fixed it for me

I know this has nothing to do with conda per se, but I got here through google after a fresh conda installation of matplotlib resulted in this. @JustinZhengBC has the right solution -- installing pyqt fixed it.
